001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IModelDefinition;
005import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
006import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CollectionUtil;
007
008import java.util.Collection;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.Map;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
014
015/**
016 * This mixin interface indicates that the implementation is a {@link INodeItem}
017 * that is based on an {@link IModelDefinition}. This means it has flag
018 * children.
019 * <p>
020 * If an implementation may have flag and model children, or model children
021 * only, then the {@link IFeatureModelContainerItem} should be used instead.
022 */
023public interface IFeatureFlagContainerItem extends INodeItem {
024
025  /**
026   * Get the model implementation that potentially contains flags.
027   *
028   * @return the model
029   */
030  @NonNull
031  FlagContainer getModel();
032
033  @Override
034  default Collection<IFlagNodeItem> getFlags() {
035    return getModel().getFlags();
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  default IFlagNodeItem getFlagByName(@NonNull IEnhancedQName name) {
040    return getModel().getFlagByName(name);
041  }
042
043  @Override
044  default Collection<? extends List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>>> getModelItems() {
045    // no model items
046    return CollectionUtil.emptyList();
047  }
048
049  @Override
050  default List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> getModelItemsByName(IEnhancedQName name) {
051    // no model items
052    return CollectionUtil.emptyList();
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Provides an abstract implementation of a model that contains a collection of
057   * flags.
058   */
059  class FlagContainer {
060    @NonNull
061    private final Map<Integer, IFlagNodeItem> flags;
062
063    /**
064     * Initialize the container with the provided collection of flags.
065     *
066     * @param flags
067     *          a flag mapping of qualified name to corresponding
068     *          {@link IFlagNodeItem}
069     */
070    protected FlagContainer(@NonNull Map<Integer, IFlagNodeItem> flags) {
071      this.flags = flags;
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Get a flag in this container using the associated flag qualified name.
076     *
077     * @param name
078     *          the qualified name of the flag
079     * @return the corresponding flag item or {@code null} if no flag had the
080     *         provided name
081     */
082    @Nullable
083    public IFlagNodeItem getFlagByName(@NonNull IEnhancedQName name) {
084      return flags.get(name.getIndexPosition());
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Get the flags in this container.
089     *
090     * @return the flags
091     */
092    @NonNull
093    @SuppressWarnings("null")
094    public Collection<IFlagNodeItem> getFlags() {
095      return flags.values();
096    }
097  }
098}
